Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Img

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Img
public class Img extends Object
An image class for images in the LAB color format. The bytes per pixel is 64, a long. The bytes per channel is 16, a short. The channel format is 0xTTTTLLLLAAAABBBB. The alpha channel is abbreviated to 'T', since 'A' is already taken.

      public static final long CLEAR_PIXEL
      The value of a pixel with zero light, zero A, zero B and zero alpha. Because A and B are signed floating point numbers that are converted to unsigned shorts, this number is not equal to zero.

      public Img(int width, int height, long fill)
      Constructs an image from width and height. The image is filled with the provided color. The absolute value of width and height are used. Width and height are expected to be at least 1 and at most MAX_DIMENSION, 32767.

      width - the width
      height - the height
      fill - the color

      grd - the gradient
      easing - the easing function
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the gradient image

      dest - the destination

    • mirror

      public static Img mirror(Img source, float xOrig, float yOrig, float xDest, float yDest, boolean flip, Img target)
      Mirrors, or reflects, pixels from a source image across the axis described by an origin and destination. Coordinates are expected to be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. Out-of-bounds pixels are omitted from the mirror.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      xOrig - the origin x
      yOrig - the origin y
      xDest - the destination x
      yDest - the destination y
      flip - the flip reflection flag
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the mirrored image

    • paletteExtract

      public static Lab[] paletteExtract(Img source, int threshold, int capacity)
      Extracts a palette from an image. If there are more colors than the threshold, engages an octree to reduce the number of colors. The higher the octree node capacity, the fewer colors will be in the palette.
      Parameters:
      source - the input image
      threshold - the threshold
      capacity - the octree capacity
      Returns:
      the palette

    • paletteExtract

      public static Lab[] paletteExtract(Img source, int threshold, int capacity, boolean inclAlpha)
      Extracts a palette from an image. If there are more colors than the threshold, engages an octree to reduce the number of colors. The higher the octree node capacity, the fewer colors will be in the palette. Alpha is no longer supported once the octree is engaged.

      Clear black is always the first entry in the palette.
      Parameters:
      source - the input image
      threshold - the threshold
      capacity - the octree capacity
      inclAlpha - whether to include alpha
      Returns:
      the palette

    • replaceColorApprox

      public static Img replaceColorApprox(Img source, Lab fromColor, Lab toColor, float tolerance, float alphaScalar, Img target)
      Replaces source pixel colors that are similar to the fromColor with the toColor.

      The tolerance is the radius beneath which colors are considered similar.

      The alpha scalar adjusts how much alpha contributes to color difference. Set it to zero for none, or to 100 for parity with lightness.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      fromColor - the color to replace
      toColor - the substitute color
      tolerance - the distance radius
      alphaScalar - alpha scalar
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the updated image

    • replaceColorExact

      public static Img replaceColorExact(Img source, Lab fromColor, Lab toColor, Img target)

      fromColor - the color to replace
      toColor - the substitute color
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the updated image

      the trimmed image

    • trimAlpha

      public static Img trimAlpha(Img source, Img target, Vec2 tl)
      Removes excess transparent pixels from an array of pixels. Adapted from the implementation by Oleg Mikhailov: https://stackoverflow.com/a/36938923.

      Emits the new image dimensions to a Vec2.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      tl - top left
      Returns:
      the trimmed image

    • wrap

      public static Img wrap(Img source, int dx, int dy, Img target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image, using integer floor modulo to wrap the source image. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of an infinite background.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      dx - the horizontal pixel offset
      dy - the vertical pixel offset
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the wrapped pixels

    • dither

      protected static Img dither(Img source, float fac, BiFunction<Lab,Lab,Lab> closestFunc, Img target)
      Dithers an image according to a closest function. The closest function is expected to accept a source and target color; the target will be modified by the function, then returned.
      Parameters:
      source - the input image
      fac - the dither factor
      closestFunc - the closest function
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the dithered image.

    • invert

      protected static Img invert(Img source, long mask, Img target)
      Inverts an image colors per a mask.
      Parameters:
      source - the input image
      mask - the mask
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the inverted image

    • rotateBilinear

      protected static Img rotateBilinear(Img source, float cosa, float sina, Img target)
      Rotates the pixels of a source image around the image center by an angle in radians. Assumes that the sine and cosine of the angle have already been calculated and simple cases (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees) have been filtered out.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      cosa - the cosine of the angle
      sina - the sine of the angle
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      rotated pixels
      See Also:
      • Utils.abs(float)

    • sampleBilinear

      protected static long sampleBilinear(Img img, float xSrc, float ySrc)
      Internal helper function to sample a source image with a bilinear color mix.
      Parameters:
      img - the source image
      xSrc - the x coordinate
      ySrc - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the color

    • similar

      protected static boolean similar(Img a, Img b)
      Evaluates whether two images are similar enough that they can serve as source and target in a static method. To be similar, images must have the same width, height and pixel length.
      Parameters:
      a - the source candidate
      b - the target candidate
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • toMesh

      protected static Mesh2 toMesh(ArrayList<Integer> indices, int wSrc, float left, float top, float right, float bottom, float tou, float tov, PolyType poly, Mesh2 target)
      Internal helper method to create a mesh from a list of indices and other conversion data. Makes no optimizations to the mesh by, e.g., removing interior or colinear vertices.
      Parameters:
      indices - the non-zero image pixel indices
      wSrc - the image width
      left - the left edge
      top - the top edge
      right - the right edge
      bottom - the bottom edge
      tou - width to uv conversion
      tov - height to uv conversion
      poly - polygon type
      target - the output mesh
      Returns:
      the mesh
